Animal,inhabits,some,Habitat.description: This class includes both terrestrial and aquatic species, highlighting the vast array of forms and behaviors found within the animal kingdom. The constraint regarding the habitats in which animals may reside has been removed.
Animal,inhabits,some,Habitat.reason: The removal transformation eliminates any dependency on the 'inhabits' relationship, thereby decoupling the support text from the constraint about specific habitats.

Animal,inhabits,some,Habitat.description: This class includes both terrestrial and aquatic species, highlighting the vast array of forms and behaviors found within the animal kingdom. If any habitats are inhabited by an animal, they must all be the specified Habitat.
Animal,inhabits,some,Habitat.reason: The 'only' variant emphasizes that should any habitat associations exist, they are restricted exclusively to the defined Habitat, thereby refining the original constraint.

AnimalCollective,has-member,only,Animal.description: Each collective must include at least one member from the animal kingdom, ensuring that the diverse behaviors and interactions among species are represented.

This variant emphasizes the necessity of including animal members without excluding the possibility of other characteristics.

Apple,eaten-by,some,Animal.description: Apples are typically sweet and versatile fruits, celebrated for their nutritional benefits and diverse culinary uses. They contribute to ecosystems in various ways without specifically being defined by which species consume them.
Apple,eaten-by,some,Animal.reason: By removing the constraint, the support text no longer ties the ecological role of apples to consumption by any particular group, thus eliminating any mention of the eaten-by relation.

Apple,eaten-by,some,Animal.reason: The 'only' variant emphasizes that while apples are eaten by animals, any consumption must be limited strictly to animals, which aligns with the modified constraint.

Bask,has-member,only,Animal.description: Bask refers to a specific type of collective behavior where individuals gather in a sunlit area to absorb warmth. This description now focuses solely on the environmental and behavioral aspects, without referencing any specific membership or species.

Berry,eaten-by,some,Animal.description: Berries are recognized for their small, pulpy form and vibrant flavors, playing a significant role in natural ecosystems through seed dispersal and agricultural cultivation. Their identity is based solely on their intrinsic properties, independent of any interactions with other organisms.
